channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Near 41 Delancey St and the bus stop, next to the black painted wall., 26th September
item.description:
This street lamp has not been working for months. It is far too dark and dangerous without a working street lamp.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41, Delancey Street, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 locations where lamp post lights are out, 26th September
item.description:
The lamp post lights have been out for some time now. The first one is located opposite the church car park on Chapel Hill, the next one is on the corner of Chapel Hill and Bexley Lane and the last one is outside the entrance to the church as you come into London Road from Bexley Lane. It is very very dark without these lights not being on and is becoming a safety concern

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chapel Hill, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Truman’s road restaurant bins overloaded, pulled on top & on the pavement, 26th September
item.description:
Yet another few days of black rubbish bags pilled on top of bins & left on the pavements. Ongoing fox, rat attracting waste bins , fluids, liquids pulled up as usual . Daily disgusting occurrence that never stops.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Road, London

item.title: Overgrown leaves around base of a tree on the pavement, 26th September
item.description:
There are overgrown leaves and branches at the base of a tree located on a corner bend between Goodrich Road and Crystal Palace Road on the pavement outside houses and near a newsagent's shop. The pavement is very narrow to pass, so please could the leaves and prickly branches be cut back as soon as possible please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 285, Crystal Palace Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Clearance, 25th September
item.description:
This is weeks of a non collection by the black top bin collection men. I am contacting in behalf of my client as she doesn’t have the ability to do so her self. I am her carer. My self and my office have contacted the council a number of times to fix the problem and arrange a collection. This still hasn’t been done. It has been nearly or just over a month of non collection. This is causing a build up of rubbish, left over food & general waste. It has now got to the point of causing rats. So please if someone could contact me or arrange a clearance& some new black top bins it would be great. Please contact me if needed: 07956549595 or my email: ronninash@icloud.com Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Herbert Road, Shooters Hill, Woolwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitmore Road, Beckenham, London

item.title: Blocked public road to charge electric cars, 25th September
item.description:
I am writing to formally report an ongoing issue with two residents at 73 and 74 Grasshaven Way, SE28 8TL. Both households are repeatedly blocking a public road by placing bins in the parking spaces in front of their houses to reserve them exclusively for their electric cars. They have also marked the road as if it were a private parking space, which is not permitted. In addition, they are running an electric charging cable over the public footpath to their cars. This presents a serious safety hazard to pedestrians and is illegal under highway regulations. When other residents or visitors park in these spaces, the neighbours in question either knock on doors demanding that cars be moved or leave notes stating that the space is “theirs.” On one occasion, they even blamed us for preventing them from charging their car and missing work. This behaviour is unfair, unsafe, and against the law. These are public parking spaces, and all residents have equal rights to use them. I kindly request that the council investigate this matter, enforce the relevant regulations, and take appropriate action to stop the obstruction and illegal charging practice. I have attached photographs of the bins, the blocked road, and the two cars for your reference. Thank you for your assistance in resolving this issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grasshaven Way, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cross of St George attached to lampost opposite mosque., 25th September
item.description:
The only flag on a lampost in Sidcup is placed opposite the mosque. This is clearly intimidatory. It has gone up just in time for the holy day. If you don't think this will raise community tension, I would like to know what you think will.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Road, Longlands, London
